name: AE-ITCX-027 AS:3003-Table B1 Patient Area CL (Rev 0)
template name: AE-ITCX-027 AS:3003-Table B1 Patient Area CL (Rev 0)

name: Preface
Appendix B: Summary of Information - Pass once confirmed
Commissioning Inspection Checklist
B1: General
This Appendix sets out a checklist for electrical area installations in accordance with this standard
All body-protected and cardiac-protected electrical areas shall be in accordance with this Standard by the use of a commissioning checklist

The commissioning results may be recorded electronically, on paper, or other similar medium. The commissioning checklist shall be retained by the person conducting the tests and a copy provided to the responsible organisation/entity. 
NOTE:This checklist can also be used for special patient areas as specified in Section 5
B2: Commissioning Inspection Checklist for Patient Areas
A checklist shall be developed to record the results for each patient area commissioned, in accordance with each of the required clauses of this Standard

The checklist shall be in English, and shall clearly record the result for each item.
NOTE: Checked boxes with a 'Pass' or 'Fail' or 'N/A' would satisfy this requirement
B3: Commissioning Checklist
The information in Table B1 shall be included in the commissioning checklist and have a result recorded against each item
2.1: General Requirements for Body-Protected and Cardiac-Protected Electrical Areas

2.1 - All locations that form part of the current works and which it is intended that low-voltage medical electrical equipment will be used in contact with patients and can be operated while connected to the electrical supply mains (except in emergencies) are checked to confirm that they are signposted as bidy-protected or cardiac-protected electrical areas
Where there is doubt about the intended use of a particular location, formal clarification should be sought from the responsible organisation

If an area is not required to be wired as a patient area a letter stating that mains operated medical electrical equipment will not be used within that area should be provided by the responsible organisation
2.1 - Cardiac-protected and body-protected electrical areas not in the same room
Classification of Patient Areas
2.2.3 - Only those specified areas are wired as cardiac-protected
If others nominated, then confirm documentation outlining specific requirements is provided by responsible organisation
2.2.4 - Patient areas not wired as cardiac-protected electrical areas are wires as body-protected electrical areas
All patient ensuites, bathrooms, shower rooms and toilets wired a body-protected electrical areas
Low-Voltage A.C. Supplies
2.4.1.1 - Confirm that electrical final sub-circuits are unique to respective rooms in body-protected electrical areas
Ensuite in adjoining room may share final sub-circuit
Confirm that cleaning outlets are on a separate electrical sub-circuit to other socket-outlets in the room
2.4.1.2 - Confirm that electrical final sub-circuits are unique to respective rooms in cardiac-protected electrical areas
2.4.1.3 - Final sub-circuit for socket-outlets identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY' supplies no other socket-outlets
2.4.2 - Confirm conformance with AS/NZS:3000 for protection against mechanical damage
2.4.3.2.1 - Confirm by inspection and testing that al socket-outlets specified are protected by LPD (except those exempted)
2.4.3.2.2(a) - Socket-outlets that are accessible in patient areas without using a key or tool
2.4.3.2.2(b) - Excludes multi-phase outlets conforming with AS/NZS:3123

Socket-outlets conforming with AS/NZS:3112 that are located within 2.0m of the entrance to a body-protected electrical area and are accessible without the use of a key or tool in any room, corridor, etc., opening directly off a patient area

Socket-outlets conforming with AS/NZS:3112 that are located within 5.0m of the entrance to a cardiac-protected patient area and are accessible without the use of a kay or tool in any room, corridor, etc., opening directly off a patient area
2.4.3.2.2(c) - Socket-outlet(s) installed outside the patient area but used to supply medical electrical equipment used within the patient area
2.4.3.2.3 - LPD protection not required for permanently installed pendant-type sockets that will not accept common 10 or 15A plugs conforming to AS/NZS:3112

LPD protection required for socket-outlets that are mounted on, and form part of, a permanently installed medical system provided that such socket-outlets are clearly intended to power specified component parts of the medical electrical system
LPD protection not required for socket-outlets specifically intended for clocks

2.4.3.2.2(a) - LPD protection not required for socket-outlets that are mounted on the ceiling or above 2.3m on the wall, and are clearly intended for permanently mounted plug-in equipment other than medical electrical equipment
2.4.3.3 - LPD protection provided for permanently wired medical electrical equipment with Type B applied parts, consisting
Electrodes or transducers that contact patients
Parts that enter patients
Parts that contact liquid in patients
Other permanently wired electrical equipment is protected as required by AS/NZS:3000
2.4.4.1 - Where the switchboard from which the UPS is to be supplied contains an essential supply of sufficient capacity the UPS is connected to that essential supply
2.4.4.2 - Where the output circuit of the UPS is earth-free in every mode of operation, the UPS is treated as an isolation transformer and provided with a LIM
Where one output terminal of the UPS is connected to the neutral input terminal earthed within the UPS, the output is protected by RCD or isolated supply
2.4.4.3 - A suitably located UPS status indicator is provided where socket-outlets or permanently wired equipment are connected to a UPS and there is continuous patient observation
Confirm that the alarm/indicator operates as intended
Low-voltage D.C. Supplies
2.5 - Reticulated low-voltage D.C. - Confirm that they are earth-free and measure current
Current
Access to Controls & Indicators
2.6 - Confirm that Controls & Indicators are readily accessible
Confirm that Controls & Indicators, depending on the location of socket-outlets or permanently connected equipment requiring LPD protection, located in accordance with Table 2.1
Confirm that Controls & Indicators, Not mounted under benches, within cupboards or cabinets, or behind bulky equipment in such manner as to inhibit easy access to the controls and indicators
Confirm that Controls & Indicators, if mounted ne the entrance of a room, separated by at least 500mm from any wall-mounted light switch
The above checked requirements do not apply to RCDs protecting socket-outlets that are identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY' in accordance with Clause 2.7.3 or RCDs mounted in ensuite vanities
Socket-Outlets
2.7.2 - Socket-outlets that are not readily accessible and are not protected by a dedicated LPD are provided with a separate readily accessible isolating double-pole switch
2.7.3.1 - In body-protected electrical areas, confirm socket-outlet identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY' within 15.0m of any point in the patient area
In cardiac-protected electrical areas, confirm socket-outlet identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY' within the patient area
2.7.3.2 - Socket-outlets that are identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY' are protected by LPDs that do not protect any other type of socket-outlet
2.7.4 - Correct labelling is used
2.7.4.1 - Socket-outlets protected by LPD are labelled 'From RCDX' or 'From LIMX', depending on whether the LPD is an RCD or isolated supply
2.7.4.2 - Confirm 'ON' indication of socket-outlet switch
2.7.4.3 - Confirm socket-outlets connected to a normal (mains) supply are colour-coded white
Confirm socket-outlets connected to an essential supply are colour-coded red
Confirm socket-outlets connected to an uninterruptible supply are colour-coded dark blue
Confirm socket-outlets identified 'CLEANING PURPOSES ONLY' are colour-coded beige
2.7.4.4 - Confirm indicator colour and operation
2.7.5 - Confirm each socket-outlet is individually switched
Confirm if socket-outlet supplied from isolated supply then it is double poled
Residual Current Devices (RCDs)
2.8.1 - Confirm Type1 RCDs in use
Confirm RCD sensitivity using tests in this Standard (and record results)
RCD result
Confirm RCD maximum tripping time using tests in this Standard (and record results)
RCD result
Check cClauses 8.2.3.2 and 8.2.3.3 for body-protected areas or Clauses 8.3.4.2 and 8.3.4.3 for cardiac-protected areas
2.8.2 - Confirm by inspection and testing that there are no RCDs protecting other RCDs
2.8.1 - Confirm by testing that all RCDs are double poled
2.8.3 - Confirm that RCDs that are used as LPDs do not protect the supply to the below
More than 12 electrical points, i.e. socket-outlets, items of permanently-wired equipment or combinations thereof
Socket-outlets in different rooms

Socket-outlets in a a patient area and socket-outlets in an area that is not a patient area except, if applicable, for socket-outlets mounted in the ceiling space of a patient area in accordance with Clause 2.4.3.2(iii)
2.8.4 - Confirm indicator colour and operation of power available indicator of RCDs used as LPDs
2.8.5 - Confirm by inspection that each RCD is labelled to identify distribution board and circuit breaker, and with unique identifier, e.g. RCD X
2.8.7 - Confirm that separate test facility is provided for RCD used as LPD when connected to permanently wired equipment
Low Voltage Isolated Supplies
2.9.1 - Confirm isolation transformer LIM and overload monitor are correctly labelled that they conform with AS/NZS:4510
2.9.2 - Confirm by examining the location, housing and ventilation of the isolation transformer
In cardiac-protected electrical areas, confirm that isolation transformer only supplies one patient location
2.9.3 - See to Clause 2.9.3
2.9.4 - Confirm overload monitor by inspection and testing using tests in this Standard (and record results)
RCD result
2.9.5 - Confirm LIM prospective hazard current display and current alarm using tests in this Standard (and record results)
RCD result
Confirm by inspection that labelling is consistent and identifies circuit and LIM
See to Clause 2.9.3
2.9.6 - Confirm prospective hazard current of each transformer-isolated supply does not exceed 2mA
For commissioning, the PHC under normal conditions of operation shall be confirmed by applying the following process to each transformer Line Isolation Overload Monitor (LIOM)
All electrical equipment are disconnected from the supply

The current flowing through a low impedance ammeter connected between one isolated supply conductor and earth is noted. The test is repeated for the other isolated supply conductor. The larger of the noted values is the prospective hazard current. It shall be less than 2mA
The prospective hazard current of the supply is recorded in the commissioning checklist
2.9.7 - In body-protected electrical areas, confirm that the number of socket-outlets protected by isolated supply does not exceed 12
In cardiac-protected electrical areas, confirm that the number of socket-outlets protected by isolated supply does not exceed 12
2.9.8 - Confirm that a test facility is provided if permanently wired equipment is protected by an individual isolated supply
Isolation Switches
2.10 - Confirm that a separate individual readily accessible switch(s) has been provided for the below
For conductors that supply an inaccessible socket-outlet that is protected by an LPD
To permanently wired electronical equipment that is connected to an LPD that also protects socket-outlets
Confirm correct labelling of the switch
Identification
2.12.1 - Confirm labelling is of the correct format and size and placed in correct location
2.12.2 - Confirm patient area signage installed in correct location and appropriate labels attached and signed
Testing & Verification of Electrical Work
2.13 - To confirm that requirements of this Standard have been met, after completion, but before being placed in service, the installation shall be as per below
Inspected as far as is practicable
Tested and confirmed in accordance with Appendix B of this Standard and AS/NZS:3000
Additional Documentation
2.14 - Confirm commissioning checklist in accordance with Appendix B
3.2 - Additional requirements for body-protected electrical areas - Earthing
Confirm conformance with AS/NZS:3000
4.2 - Additional requirements for cardiac-protected electrical areas - Earth-Free ELV
Confirm that no more than 10mA can flow to earth
4.3 - Disposition of electrical points controlled by LPDs
Confirm by tripping all RCDs in a particular patient location, to confirm that socket-outlets in any other patient location(s) are not protected
Earthing & Equipotential Bonding
4.4.1 - Confirm earthing ha sbeen carried out in accordance with the requirements of this Clause and the requirements of AS/NZS:3000
The minimum size of any protective earthing system conductor shall be not less than that required by AS?NZS:3000
The minimum size of any EP bonding system conductor associated with the fixed wiring installed on site shall be 4mm2
4.4.2.3 - Confirm by inspection that only one EP junction is in use
4.4.2.4.1 - Confirm by inspection and testing that the resistance of the earthing conductor between each socket-outlet and EP junction or node is <=0.1 Ohm For the below
Socket-outlets within cardiac-protected electrical area
Socket-outlets within specified distance of entrance to cardiac-protected electrical area
Socket-outlets in another room/ceilings for medical electrical equipment with conductive parts accessible within cardiac-protected electrical area
Confirm protective earthing conductors are insulated and segregated from other conductive items
Confirm the below by inspecting and testing
Each node is individually connected to the EP junction by insulated conductors with a maximum resistance of 0.01 Ohms
Each node is accessible and its location identified by labelling
Each node is fully insulated or isolated from contact with structural metal
Each node is numbered and identified to identify the location of the EP junction
4.4.1 - Confirm earthing has been carried out in accordance with the requirements of this Clause and the requirements of AS/NZS:3000
The EP junction is identified to identify the number of nodes connected
4.4.2.4.1 - Confirm inspection and testing that the following socket-outlets conforming to Clause4.4.2.4.1 are connected to an EP junction or node

All socket-outlets that are accessible anywhere in the cardiac-protected electrical area without using a key or a tool, including those that are mounted on permanently installed electrical equipment and are available for general use

All socket-outlets that conform with AS/NZS:3112 or AS/NZS:60884.1, or both, and are located within 5.0m of the entrance to the cardiac-protected electrical area and accessible without the use of a key or tool in any room, corridor, etc,., opening directly off the cardiac-protected electrical area
Confirm that these outlets are only connected by one EP earthing system
Socket-outlets that are installed outside cardiac-protected electrical area but are used to supply medical electrical equipment
4.4.2.4.1 - Confirm earthing in accordance with AS/NZS:3000
Permanently installed cord extension sockets that are part of a medical electrical equipment system and will not accept common 10A plugs
Earth pin of socket-outlets for clocks

4.4.2.4.2 - Confirm that the protective earthing conductors used to connect socket-outlets to the EP junction or node is insulated and segregated from contacting other conductive items except at the EP junction
Check the resistance between the earth pin of the socket-outlet and the EP junction or node is <+0.1 Ohms using a four-wire milliohm measuring device
4.4.2.5 - Confirm by inspection and measurement that the following (if within patient environment) are directly earthed to the EP junction or node with a resistance of <+0.1 Ohms:
The protective earthing terminal of permanently installed Class1 electrical equipment that is accessible within patient environment
Metal enclosure containing socket-outlets

4.4.2.6 - Confirm by inspection and measurement that the following (if within patient environment) and measure <1 Mega Ohm with respect to the EP junction or node are directly earthed to the EP junction or node with a resistance of <=0.1 Ohms
Medical gas outlets and water taps contact reticulated metal services such as medical gas, water or drainpipes, the reticulated metal services etc
Accessible fittings such as hinged window frames or lift-out air-conditioning registers, etc
4.4.2.7 - Confirm inspection (except for EP junctions) that all joints are as per below
Fully insulated or isolated from contact with structural metal
Effected so that conductors forming part of the equipotential earthing systems are not joined in tunnel connectors in which a single screw bears directly on the conductors
4.4.2.8 - Confirm where EP junction is readily accessible within the cardiac area it is identified
EP Test Point
0.1 Ohm Ep Earthing System
EP Junction
4.4.2.9 - Confirm where the EP junction is not readily accessible in the cardiac-protected electrical area, a test facility is provided as per below
Isolated from structural steel
Identified 'EP Test Point'
Identified '0.1 Ohms EP Earthing System'
Indicates the location of the EP junction
4.4.2.10 - Confirm that the EP test terminal between EP junction or node has resistance of <+0.01 Ohms
Confirm that the EP test terminal is not used for any other purpose
Confirm that the EP test terminal has separate individual return earths
4.4.3 - Confirm return to earth distribution board supplying the cardiac-protected electrical area
Confirm each return earth is labelled correctly at the EP junction and the distribution board
Confirm each EP junction has separate individual return earths
Alterations & Repairs to Electrical Installations in Patient Areas
6.2.1 - Confirm that every alteration of the electrical installation in an existing patient area conforms with all relevant provisions of the Standard
6.2.3 - Confirm inspection within the last 12 months before carrying out any alterations
Confirm in-service sticker is current

6.2.5.1 - Confirm EP wiring system as per below
EP junction accessible
EP test point labelled
Confirm the rating of the new fixed electrical equipment
6.2.5.2 - Conformance is checked by confirming or actioning Items (a) to (c) of Clause 6.2.5.1
6.2.5.3 - For the reclassification of a cardiac-protected electrical area to a body-protected electrical area, verify the below
Conformance with Sections 2 & 3, except that, the requirement of Clause 2.4.1.3 for a claner's outlet to have a dedicated circuit need not apply
All EP studs or EP receptacles removed
Re-certification as a body-protected electrical area in accordance with Clause 2.13
Identification in accordance with Clause 2.12
Repairs

6.3.1 - If the patient ares is not sign posted as a cardiac-protected electrical area or a body-protected electrical area, the repairs may only be completed when the patient area meets the requirements of this Standard
6.3.2 - Confirm that the repair is only an equivalent fitting replacement and not the replacement for the fixed electrical equipment
7.1, 7.2. 7.3 - Identification of Patient Areas
Confirm that sign is correct size, affixed in correct location, correctly completed, dated and sighted and the tester clearly identified
Where alterations have occurred, confirm addition of label stating this and indicating the date, name and organisation responsible
